summary: Jules Verne møder Star Wars i kampen mod en kvantesyg verden Kvantevåben, larvefødder og ingeniør-foragt mødes i filmen ‘Mortal...
caption:
Jules Verne møder Star Wars i kampen mod en kvantesyg verden
Kvantevåben, larvefødder og ingeniør-foragt mødes i filmen ‘Mortal Engines’, der har premiere torsdag. En Peter Jackson-film, hvor teknik fra 1800-tallet får fremtidskræfter.

summary: 379 days until Episode IX
title: 379 days until Episode IX

summary: I was very numb. The first time I saw it was with Carrie Fisher and Daisy Ridley and Carrie’s dog, Gary. And you don’t know how...
text: I was very numb. The first time I saw it was with Carrie Fisher and Daisy Ridley and Carrie’s dog, Gary. And you don’t know how to feel. You’ve been working on it for so long and thinking about it for so long. That’s one of the many reasons I try not to watch anything. To really absorb it, I feel like you’ve got to watch it a lot to think that it’s not you there doing it. To look at the story and not just all the mistakes you made. But I was very numb. It was a lot to take in.Then, I saw it again at the premiere. I had never sat in the audience of a premiere of a movie I was in before. Something like that, because I knew what was coming up, the Han scene, I was very sick to my stomach, very pale, cold, waiting for it just to be over. Then, the response was so nice. It was a very memorable, crazy night.
source: Adam Driver on watching The Force Awakens. [LAT]

blog.name: dingoat
blog.title: bork
blog.description: Hobby artist, wildlife enthusiast. I like to RP and draw shit, especially stuff involving what me and my partners in creative crime play out. Active on swtor (Star Forge; 'Ahuska' Impside and 'Ahuska Crow' Pubside) and ffxiv (Balmung; Ahuska Crow). Bothan Mandalorian, lost and scared Miqo'te Keeper. Don't be afraid to say hi!

tags: YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT I'M GOING THROUGH HERE
summary:
"This is what we live for, Rowan! This is what we DO! Gods I missed this!"
 "I missed it too, Crow. Piloting, eh?! Against all...
caption:
“This is what we live for, Rowan! This is what we DO! Gods I missed this!”
“I missed it too, Crow. Piloting, eh?! Against all odds!”
“Against all odds!” Crow echoed, cackling.

They twisted around an enemy ship chasing down a small group of fleeing fighters.

 "Hey what do you think Eden-“ There was a sudden flurry of fire from behind from auto-turrets and a flock of new bogies coming up from behind. Then a flash of fire, of red as the comm cut short. In plain view of the whole ship Rowan’s ship was engulfed in blaster fire. The metal seemed to swell, expand, there was a huff of fire as it blew out and then nothing. A husk. A skeleton to add to the rest.

—

So y’all never got the chance to meet Rowan he was an absolute gem and NOW HE’S GONE and this is NOT EVEN CLOSE TO THE WORST THING GOING ON RIGHT NOW

all current torture the intellectual property of one @humanrevolt >:(

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

tags: I didn't use it all but some of your suggestion
summary: Because I can’t resist filling in Ben/Obi-Wan’s response to Anakin/Vader’s comment at the end of Blackened Souls...  “Apparently...
question: Because I can’t resist filling in Ben/Obi-Wan’s response to Anakin/Vader’s comment at the end of Blackened Souls...  “Apparently you are quite swoon worthy. My apologizes, I don’t know what came over me...”  “My father apparently should have warned you that you were going to be graced with the presence  of the sun.”  “Really?  And here I thought I was being overtaken by the beauty of an eclipse.”
answer:
Blinking confusedly up at the smiling blond over him, Ben let the words rumble around in his head for a few moments before putting on his most charming smile. “I apologize but I thought the sun god himself had decided to grace me with their presence with how golden you are.” He grinned roguishly up at the other.

Clearly taken off guard for a moment the man who must be Anakin stared at him before laughing and helping Ben sit up with careful hands that lingered on his shoulders and Ben found that he wasn’t adverse to the touch, no indeed this young Adonis attention was quite flattering if he had to say such a thing.

And then he realized he had fainted and flushed darkly, the color clashing horribly with his red hair as he peered at the other three with an apologetic smile on his face. “I am so sorry, I didn’t mean t-”

Yan cut in, his tone sharp but Ben felt that it was milder than earlier. “Nonsense young man, you haven nothing to apologize for. I imagine its been a long day for you and we’re keeping you awake. I’m sure you have someone waiting for you.” He reached for his cup.

Once more coloring even deeper and burning a bit in humiliation, Ben shrugged a bit before deciding on a verbal answer. “I’m sorry to say that there is no one waiting for me. I live alone and… well if I have family I wouldn’t know.” He admitted to them.

He felt comfortable in admitting such at deeply rooted thing to these people he had just meet, these strangers and yet Ben couldn’t help but share with them.

“Oh? You don’t know?” Qui-Gon questioned with a small frown, pouring a glass of water that he offered to Ben.

Taking the glass while contemplating what to say, Ben decided that honesty wouldn’t be amiss and for some reason he felt compelled to answer. “I have memory loss you see,” Ben informed then with a small shrug, smiling sadly as he took a small sip of water to wet his throat. “I was found five years ago in a ditch and… well I haven’t remembered anything since then and instead just built a life from scratch with what little I had.” He laughed awkwardly, rubbing the back of his neck with a cup warmed hand as he sat his cup down on the coffee table as all those pairs of blue eyes observed him, all of them different in shade but all of them beautiful in their own way.

“…Oh you poor thing!” Jocasta was on her feet, throwing her arms around Ben in a warm hug with Anakin quickly snatching the glass out of his hand before Jocasta could make it spill and normally Ben had a tendency to flinch away from strangers but once more he felt like this had happened before.

He felt warm… and safe.

He wanted to lean into the hug and not escape it like he normally wished to.

‘How strange, I feel safe here…’ Ben swallowed heavily, tears pressing up in his eyes before he managed to get them under control and give Jocasta a misty smile when she pulled back. “Thank you, I’m alright, honestly.” He murmured and took the water from Anakin again to sip and cover his flustered expression.

He missed the fond expressions over his head and the craving in Anakin’s to just wrap his arms around him and never let go.

“To be honest it is late and I should go home, I do have an early morning tomorrow teaching a class,” He noted, glancing at a round metal clock hanging on the wall before settling the glass down and standing up, giving them all a polite smile and a little bow. “Thank you for having me over.”

Jocasta instantly bounced to take his arm, sliding it into the crook of her arm as she escorted him to the door. “Of course! Please do come again, we would love your company any time Ben, as polite as you are you simply must come over. Perhaps tuesday, for dinner?” She chatted away.

“Ah, well…” Ben blinked before smiling, giving in to her warm grandmotherly smile. “Well, that does sound nice. Yes, I’ll come by on tuesday for dinner.” He nodded in concession, trying not to think of the other reason he was agreeing.

And then he was off, walking across the street, picking up his bag and slipping into his own home.

How odd, he felt… warmer than in a long time.

reblog.comment:

“Oh? You don’t know?” Qui-Gon questioned with a small frown, pouring a glass of water that he offered to Ben.

Taking the glass while contemplating what to say, Ben decided that honesty wouldn’t be amiss and for some reason he felt compelled to answer. “I have memory loss you see,” Ben informed then with a small shrug, smiling sadly as he took a small sip of water to wet his throat. “I was found five years ago in a ditch and… well I haven’t remembered anything since then and instead just built a life from scratch with what little I had.” He laughed awkwardly, rubbing the back of his neck with a cup warmed hand as he sat his cup down on the coffee table as all those pairs of blue eyes observed him, all of them different in shade but all of them beautiful in their own way.

“…Oh you poor thing!” Jocasta was on her feet, throwing her arms around Ben in a warm hug with Anakin quickly snatching the glass out of his hand before Jocasta could make it spill and normally Ben had a tendency to flinch away from strangers but once more he felt like this had happened before.

He felt warm… and safe.

He wanted to lean into the hug and not escape it like he normally wished to.

‘How strange, I feel safe here…’ Ben swallowed heavily, tears pressing up in his eyes before he managed to get them under control and give Jocasta a misty smile when she pulled back. “Thank you, I’m alright, honestly.” He murmured and took the water from Anakin again to sip and cover his flustered expression.

He missed the fond expressions over his head and the craving in Anakin’s to just wrap his arms around him and never let go.

“To be honest it is late and I should go home, I do have an early morning tomorrow teaching a class,” He noted, glancing at a round metal clock hanging on the wall before settling the glass down and standing up, giving them all a polite smile and a little bow. “Thank you for having me over.”

Jocasta instantly bounced to take his arm, sliding it into the crook of her arm as she escorted him to the door. “Of course! Please do come again, we would love your company any time Ben, as polite as you are you simply must come over. Perhaps tuesday, for dinner?” She chatted away.

“Ah, well…” Ben blinked before smiling, giving in to her warm grandmotherly smile. “Well, that does sound nice. Yes, I’ll come by on tuesday for dinner.” He nodded in concession, trying not to think of the other reason he was agreeing.

And then he was off, walking across the street, picking up his bag and slipping into his own home.

How odd, he felt… warmer than in a long time.

trail.content_raw:
Blinking confusedly up at the smiling blond over him, Ben let the words rumble around in his head for a few moments before putting on his most charming smile. “I apologize but I thought the sun god himself had decided to grace me with their presence with how golden you are.” He grinned roguishly up at the other.

Clearly taken off guard for a moment the man who must be Anakin stared at him before laughing and helping Ben sit up with careful hands that lingered on his shoulders and Ben found that he wasn’t adverse to the touch, no indeed this young Adonis attention was quite flattering if he had to say such a thing.

And then he realized he had fainted and flushed darkly, the color clashing horribly with his red hair as he peered at the other three with an apologetic smile on his face. “I am so sorry, I didn’t mean t-”

Yan cut in, his tone sharp but Ben felt that it was milder than earlier. “Nonsense young man, you haven nothing to apologize for. I imagine its been a long day for you and we’re keeping you awake. I’m sure you have someone waiting for you.” He reached for his cup.

Once more coloring even deeper and burning a bit in humiliation, Ben shrugged a bit before deciding on a verbal answer. “I’m sorry to say that there is no one waiting for me. I live alone and… well if I have family I wouldn’t know.” He admitted to them.

He felt comfortable in admitting such at deeply rooted thing to these people he had just meet, these strangers and yet Ben couldn’t help but share with them.

“Oh? You don’t know?” Qui-Gon questioned with a small frown, pouring a glass of water that he offered to Ben.

Taking the glass while contemplating what to say, Ben decided that honesty wouldn’t be amiss and for some reason he felt compelled to answer. “I have memory loss you see,” Ben informed then with a small shrug, smiling sadly as he took a small sip of water to wet his throat. “I was found five years ago in a ditch and… well I haven’t remembered anything since then and instead just built a life from scratch with what little I had.” He laughed awkwardly, rubbing the back of his neck with a cup warmed hand as he sat his cup down on the coffee table as all those pairs of blue eyes observed him, all of them different in shade but all of them beautiful in their own way.

He felt warm… and safe.

He wanted to lean into the hug and not escape it like he normally wished to.

‘How strange, I feel safe here…’ Ben swallowed heavily, tears pressing up in his eyes before he managed to get them under control and give Jocasta a misty smile when she pulled back. “Thank you, I’m alright, honestly.” He murmured and took the water from Anakin again to sip and cover his flustered expression.

He missed the fond expressions over his head and the craving in Anakin’s to just wrap his arms around him and never let go.

“To be honest it is late and I should go home, I do have an early morning tomorrow teaching a class,” He noted, glancing at a round metal clock hanging on the wall before settling the glass down and standing up, giving them all a polite smile and a little bow. “Thank you for having me over.”

Jocasta instantly bounced to take his arm, sliding it into the crook of her arm as she escorted him to the door. “Of course! Please do come again, we would love your company any time Ben, as polite as you are you simply must come over. Perhaps tuesday, for dinner?” She chatted away.

“Ah, well…” Ben blinked before smiling, giving in to her warm grandmotherly smile. “Well, that does sound nice. Yes, I’ll come by on tuesday for dinner.” He nodded in concession, trying not to think of the other reason he was agreeing.

And then he was off, walking across the street, picking up his bag and slipping into his own home.

How odd, he felt… warmer than in a long time.

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: “Anakin, you need to snap out of it.”  “Baby!”  “Anakin it will be alright.  The child will be alright.  Padme will be alright....
question: “Anakin, you need to snap out of it.”  “Baby!”  “Anakin it will be alright.  The child will be alright.  Padme will be alright. But you need to breathe.”  “She is going to die.”  “Padme is not going to die.  She will be fine.  This isn’t your vision.  There are no droids.  There is a healer.  Your family is here with you.  But you have to breathe.”  Murder husband
answer:
Shaking the other man, Obi-Wan frowned up at Anakin as he continued shaking even in his grasp. “Anakin, you need to snap out of it.” He said as sternly as he could, ignoring Padme’s cry of pain from inside the other room.

“Baby!” Anakin yelped with a nervous look and Obi-Wan noticed Qui-Gon rolling his eyes in fond amusement where he was sitting in one of the stationed chairs by the medical station of the manor.

“Anakin it will be alright. The child will be alright. Padme will be alright. But you need to breathe.” He moved his hands from shoulders to arms, rubbing Anakin’s upper arms as a distressed expression crossed the others face.

“She is going to die.” Anakin whispered shakily, hands coming up to rip at his curls only for Obi-Wan to intercept the others hands to avoid the blond hurting himself.

Finally Qui-Gon involved himself, rumbling deeply as he spoke. “Padme is not going to die. She will be fine. This isn’t your vision. There are no droids. There is a healer. Your family is here with you. But you have to breathe,”  He murmured in his deep soothing voice as he settled a hand on both Anakin and Obi-Wan’s shoulder. “We are here for you Anakin.” He promised quietly.

Looking between the two, eyes wide, Anakin took a sharp, snapping breath before focusing back on Obi-Wan. “Help me meditate?” He pleaded while grasping Obi-Wan’s hand tightly in his.

Softening with a fond smile on his lips, Obi-Wan nodded and drew Anakin over to a little potted plant underneath a window.

It wasn’t much but it sort of looked like their little meditation nook of their old quarters in the temple.

Settling down on his knees he drew Anakin with him via the hands still holding each other as they faced each other.

He glanced to Qui-Gon, finding the other watching him fondly.

He winked lightly at him when he noticed Obi-Wan watching before sitting back down to wait.

Focusing back on Anakin as Padme let out a fresh cry, the man wincing and looking nervously towards the medical room,  Obi-Wan tightened his grip on the others hand. “One long, deep breath Anakin.” He whispered soothingly.

Following the order, Anakin did as told, taking that long deep breath.

“Good Anakin, now lean forward.” Obi-Wan murmured quietly and waited until the two were touching foreheads, smiling at the old familiar feeling of Anakin aura instantly reaching out for him for support and comfort.

He happily gave it up, letting Anakin’s storm filter through him steadily until it was a slow drizzle in the meadow as their auras combined.

Letting go of the outside world just to bask in their signatures together was as easy as breathing for Obi-Wan though he struggled a bit to bring Anakin with him as the others anxieties made it harder than usual with each new cry from behind the door.

But he managed, feeling Anakin’s calm just as a bright light entered the Force.

Joy lit up the Force with a cry, both realizing what it meant.

One of the babies were born and latching onto that joy, Obi-Wan kept Anakin in the moment of peace, of joy and tranquility.

‘One more dear one.’ He whispered across their bond.

He felt Anakin physically nod against him and rubbed his thumb on the back of the others flesh hand, helping the other release more of the anxiety out into the Force.

On the outside he could also feel Qui-Gon’s hand resting on his back and the fainter cries of Padme as yet another burst of light filled the Force with a cry with who knew how much time gone by as they meditated.

Yet another baby was born.

Both of Anakin’s children in this life with Padme’s aura clearly exhausted and frazzled but quite alive too with no sign of her strength waning anytime soon.

Obi-Wan felt Anakin pull abruptly away but only opened his eyes with a smile as he watched the back of the others tunic disappear into the medic room with Qui-Gon wrapping his arm around Obi-Wan to support him. “Give him a few moments?” The long haired man rumbled.

Nodding, Obi-Wan nestled into the others arms for comfort, breathing out.

So far, so good.
